Total capital required to do the project, not including costs associated with financing. Includes: purchase price, non-financing closing costs, holding costs and rehab budget.
This number reflects the maximum that your lender will finance based on your inputs: ARV or cost and the lender cap.

TextView.android:text: Actual to be financed (not inc. closing/holding)

Amout of total cash you will need over the life of the project, in addition to financing. This # will impact your ROI.

Total cost basis of the project divided by the ARV - this is a good sanity check for the viability of your project!!

This will indicate how much cash you are pulling out when refinancing. Compare this to your original cash investment. If this number is more, that means you are pulling out in excess of your original investment.

TextView.android:text: Profit at Refi (after any lender split)

TextView.android:tag: This is how much cash you are pulling out in excess of your cost basis in the property. This is your profit.
If #39 is more than 0, and you had to put up some of your cash for the acquisition/rehab, this will equal #52/#39 (and then annualized)- and represents your ROI on your initial cash investment.

TextView.android:text: Original money tied up after refi

Monthly cashflow after all expenses including mortgage payment, taxes, insurance, and maintenance

If you still have any of your original cash investment tied up in the property, this is your Cash-on-Cash Return (#56/#54, annualized). Otherwise, your return is infinite since you have none of your money invested.

TextView.android:text: Additional Ratios applicable for Refi Scenario

TextView.android:tag: This is a great sanity check to make sure your refi scenario is viable! This will be the new DCR (debt coverage ratio) of the new proposed loan. If DCR is lower than ~1.25, it prob won't work.
If #55 is more than zero and you still have some of your original cash investment tied up in the deal, this will tell you the payback period (in years) to recoup that money (pre-tax dollars)

TextView.android:text: Cap Rate of Property based on Cost Basis

TextView.android:tag: This number will give you your Capitalization Rate based on the total cost of the project. For an all-cash deal, this will correspond to your 1st-year cash-on-cash return

TextView.android:text: Cap Rate of Property based on ARV
